official_title: A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to permit Federal district courts to hear and determine cases brought in State courts not having jurisdiction over them.

summary.text: Removal Jurisdiction Act of 1985 - Amends Federal law to allow a Federal district court to hear and determine cases removed from State court even though the State court did not have original jurisdiction to hear the case.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 28, United States Code, to permit Federal district courts to hear and determine cases brought in State courts not having jurisdiction over them.
